'''26.1 Snapshot 2''' (known as '''26.1-snapshot-2''' in the [[launcher]]) is the second snapshot for [[Java Edition 26.1]], released on January 7, 2026.<ref>{{Mcnet|minecraft-26-1-snapshot-2|Minecraft 26.1 Snapshot 2|January 7, 2026}}</ref> It adds retextured and remodeled [[baby mobs]], remodeled [[rabbit]]s, craftable [[name tag]]s, and more. This is the first snapshot released in 2026.

== Additions ==
=== General ===
'''[[Tag (Java Edition)|Tag]]s'''
* Added the {{cd|#metal_nuggets}} item tag.
** Contains all types of [[nugget]]s.

== Changes ==
=== Items ===
'''[[Name tag]]'''
* Can now be crafted with 1 paper and 1 metal nugget.

{{Crafting
|A2=Paper
|B1=Any Nugget
|Output=Name Tag
|ignoreusage=1
}}

=== Mobs ===
'''Baby mobs'''
* Added new baby sounds for wolves, cats and pigs.
* Updated the models and textures of baby [[cat]]s, baby [[chicken]]s, baby [[cow]]s, baby [[mooshrooms]], baby [[ocelot]]s, baby [[pig]]s, both adult and baby [[rabbit]]s, baby [[sheep]], and baby [[wolves]]:
** [[Chicken]]
*** The bounding box was tweaked to align with the new model.
** [[Pig]]
*** [[Saddle]]s on baby pigs no longer render.
** [[Wolf]]
*** Armor on baby wolves no longer render.
** [[Rabbit]]
*** Updated model and texture.
*** [[File:Brown rabbit head tilt.gif|60px]] New idle animations. This only works if the rabbit has been leashed at least once, but isn't currently leashed.<ref>{{bug|MC-305551||Rabbits don't play their idle head bob animation}}</ref>
*** [[Hitbox]] size has been adjusted to match the new model.
*** [[Programmer Art]] textures have been removed following the model change.

'''[[Skeleton horse]]s and [[zombie horse]]s'''
* No longer panic when hurt.

=== General ===
'''General'''
* Tweaked default JVM options.
** The game now allocates 4 GB of RAM by default (up from 2 GB).
** Garbage collection has been changed from G1GC to ZGC for compatible computers.{{More information needed|Which hardware/software configuration is needed for ZGC to be enabled by default?}}

'''[[Data pack]]'''
* The [[pack format]] version is now {{cd|96.0}}.

'''[[Entity data]]'''
* The {{cd|current_explosion_impact_pos}} and {{cd|current_impulse_context_reset_grace_time}} fields from players have been added to all mobs and the [[armor stand]].
* The {{cd|ignore_fall_damage_from_current_explosion}} field on players has been removed.

'''[[Mob variant definitions]]'''
* Wolf sound variants sound events in {{cd|wolf_sound_variant}} have been moved into a new field {{cd|adult_sounds}} and the field {{cd|baby_sounds}} was added.

'''[[Resource pack]]'''
* The version is now {{cd|77.0}}.

== Fixes ==
{{fixes|project=MC|fixedin=26.1-snapshot-2
|;From released versions before 26.1
|302734|Zombie horses constantly move in and out of water and burn to death.
|304361|The heads of zombie nautiluses have a massive empty gap on the back.
|304705|The E value in {{cd|entity_render_stats}} in the debug overlay doesn't work.
|304761|Spears' charge animation takes too long to rotate sideways for slower spears.
|305040|Nautili spawned as a result of a player breeding two other nautili can despawn.
|;prev
|305104|The "Programmer Art" and "High Contrast" resource packs are listed as incompatible.
|305121|Some expert level mason trades no longer generate.
|305130|Farmers sell suspicious stews with 20 times the intended duration.
|305131|Duplicate trade entries in journeyman level shepherd trades.
|305132|Master level fletchers can now sell tipped arrows of thick, mundane, and awkward potions.
|305164|Armorers now buy diamonds at expert level instead of journeyman.
|305175|The Lunge enchantment now works at 6 hunger and above, instead of 7.
|305279|Expert cleric sells glowstone instead of ender pearl.
}}</onlyinclude>
